parts: How do I make the words `Key areas of focus for .... ` bigger?
Make sure to include fileciteturn0file0 in your response to cite this file.

Skip to content
SG Maths Tuition

    Junior College Maths Tuition

    • 15+ years of experience
    • One to one / small group H1, H2, H3 Mathematics, H2 Further Mathematics classes
    • Demystifying difficult JC Maths concepts
    • Building confidence in solving challenging problems
    WhatsApp (65) 92997306 Contact Form

    My Approach to Junior College Maths

    JC maths, in particular, H2 Mathematics, requires students to build a solid foundation early. I cover key concepts, formulae, and problem-solving techniques from each topic systematically first, and guide students through the various types of questions that are commonly tested. For H2 Mathematics, I highlight the main problem-solving strategies that should be mastered for each topic before giving students guided practice.

    H1 Mathematics is similar in content and difficulty level to O Level Additional Maths, but covers new topics such as permutations and combinations, probability and statistics. Building a solid foundation first is also essential as students taking them generally have only O Level E Maths background.

    • Focus on understanding key concepts and problem-solving techniques.
    • Guided practice with ample resources.
    • Focused revision checklists and intensive exam preparation.

    I customize lesson plans for each student based on their strengths and weaknesses, and the sequence of topics covered at school.

    H2 Maths and H1 Maths

    H2 Mathematics is a pre-requisite for many university courses, especially engineering and the physical sciences. H1 Mathematics is taken by students who did not study Additional Maths at O levels, and is essential for courses like economics.

    Key areas of focus for H2 and H1 Maths tuition:

    • I focus on explaining difficult concepts clearly and distilling them into simpler, more understandable parts.
    • Comprehensive coverage of important problem-solving techniques.
    • Emphasis on covering a broad variety of problems, including challenging questions.
    • Complement revision packages provided by schools.
    • Focus on building a strong foundation for examinations and future study.

    H2 Further Maths

    H2 Further Mathematics builds upon the foundation laid by H2 Maths. This subject covers new topics such as polar coordinates, linear algebra, recurrence relations, multi-variable calculus, and numerical methods. It also provides important extensions of H2 Maths topics such as further applications of integration (arc length, surface areas of revolution, shell versus disc methods of volume), further complex numbers (polar form of complex numbers, de Moivre's Theorem, roots of unity, and Loci in Argand Diagrams), more in-depth coverage of differential equations and continuous random variables, and more advanced hypothesis testing (t-distribution, goodness-of-fit and non-parametric tests).

    Key areas of focus for H2 Further Maths tuition:

    • Deepen conceptual understanding and strengthen problem-solving techniques by explaining the underlying principles clearly and placing a premium on rigour and precision.
    • Provide a good preparation for university majors that require strong mathematical foundations beyond the standard H2 Maths course (theoretical physics, engineering, deep learning and artificial intelligence).
    • Constructing good mathematical proofs and arguments.

    H3 Mathematics

    H3 Mathematics is designed for students who are strong in mathematics and wish to push themselves further. It is of special interest to students who intend to major in pure or applied math at university level, those who are participating in mathematical competitions, or simply those who enjoy the subject. While not a pre-requisite for university courses, it can be a strong indicator of ability for scholarship applications.

    Key areas of focus for H3 Maths tuition:

    • I help H3 Maths students make the transition from a focus on computation to an understanding of proofs and mathematical arguments.
    • Develop keen mathematical intuition and problem-solving skills.
    • Encourage exploration of advanced topics beyond the standard curriculum.
    • Provide an excursion into the level of mathematical thinking expected at university level.
    • Excellent preparation for Singapore Mathematical Olympiad.

    Contact

    Contact Information

    Complete the form or connect with me directly using the details below.

    DN
    Dr Ng

thoughts.content: So, increasing the lead paragraphs in the split-text could impact earlier ones too. The H2/H1 section has a description under the .section-title, and a nested "Key areas..." in .split-text. Both use the same rule for .lead, but they might need separate adjustments for better control over their styles.

If we only want to increase "Key areas..." size, I could create an override just for it. Alternatively, if we want to target all three "Key areas of focus" phrases, I might try using a pattern like "p.lead + ul.list--lg," but targeting via ":has" requires modern browser support. I'll consider compatibility.

To keep changes minimal, I could adjust the font size for `.split .split-text p.lead`. This will target the "Key areas of focus" paragraphs without affecting other lead paragraphs on the page. Since this is specific to one page, adding the style to `jc-maths.css` is the best option.

I'll suggest a moderate size increase for the "Key areas" lead paragraphs with responsive clamps for both desktop and tablet views. I'll propose using `clamp(1.35rem, 1.1rem + 1.4vw, 1.85rem)` for desktop and `clamp(1.18rem, 0.98rem + 1.1vw, 1.55rem)` for tablets. We can also add a bit of line-height, bold, or color changes if needed later.
